column2: The field of psychology has problems replicating results
column3: Replication of research is only a problem in the field of psychology
column4: The incentive structure in psychological research can undermine the broader goals of science
column5: The results from studies with low statistical power are by definition incorrect
column6: Researchers who perform replication studies are not qualified to conduct psychological research
column7: It is important for a researcher to report all measures and experimental conditions that were included in a study
column8: For a researcher, how important is choosing a sample size before running a study?
column9: How important is it to make data publicly available so that results can be verified by other researchers?
column10: How important are decisions in data collection, analysis, and reporting in affecting how likely a researcher will find a significant effect?
column11: How important is it to report studies that “don’t work out?”
column12: How important is it that results from a psychology study are counterintuitive (e.g., different from what you would expect)?
